summary: This testimony discusses the Department of Homeland Security's management of immigration in the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, a U.S. territory. Foreign workers make up a large part of the workforce. Proposed legislation could let some longer-term foreign workers and others gain CNMI resident status. DHS issues transitional permits that let qualified workers stay for up to a year. The numerical limits for these...
title: Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands: DHS Implementation of U.S. Immigration Laws
